website_summaries.verdict: This smaller sit-in kayak is a lightweight option that can provide a good beginner experience.
pros: Weighs less than 30 lb., making it easy to maneuver
Includes a storage compartment and drink holder
cons: The paddle included with this kayak is not as strong as it could be

customer_reviews.title: Perfect first kayak!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect first kayak! I tried one of these last summer with a friend and fell in love with how easy it was to handle by myself. Super easy to get in and out of the bed of my truck, which is a huge plus. Nicely built and fairly comfortable (we were out for about 3 hours). May end up buying a second one so that I can have a spare if family or friends ever want to go kayaking with me.
customer_reviews.author: Erin C. Blum

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Kayak
customer_reviews.text: the purpose of this purchase was to allow me the ability to load and unload my kayak without assistance. The Sun Dolphin fit this requirement perfectly. So its not the same as our other kayaks but I knew that going in. Some of edges were a bit rough but I sanded those and now its fine. Considering the cost I believe i have a very good value. Is it perfect and strong as a $700 kayak? No but your not spending $700.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: It's Tippy!!
customer_reviews.text: Were it possible to award zero stars I would do so. This kayak is useless for two reasons 1) The sides are too high making paddling awkward and 2) the kayak is unstable and feels as though tipping over into the water is a distinct possibility. DON"T WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS PIECE OF JUNK!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tom Corwin

customer_reviews.title: Feather like but unstable
customer_reviews.text: Bought it because it's the lightest i can find. Read the comments that it's not stable. Both are very true, so buy it or not really depends on your priority. If you value portability then it's for you. But if ultimate stability/maneuverability is what you are after, no.
customer_reviews.author: Hengchang Pan

customer_reviews.title: Good basic kayak
customer_reviews.text: Great kayak for tweens and beginners. Easy to maneuver. Good basic kayak
customer_reviews.author: Sara A Beal

customer_reviews.title: Honestly you're probably better off getting one from a store where you can actually look at it.
customer_reviews.text: This was a terrible kayak, extremely unbalanced. I couldn't comfortably paddle without feeling like it was going to tip over. I feel like it was the way the seat was constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey gearhart

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and portable
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for myself being a shorter person. Easy to travel with. Not heavy to haul. I only wish it had a better bottle/beverage holder as the. One included is in a horrible location and my water bottle is constantly rolling around unsecured inside my kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle B

customer_reviews.title: Grandsons youth kayak
customer_reviews.text: I think this will be a great little beginner kayak for my grandson. Plus side is it came with a set of paddles. We bought him smaller ones to fit. So now we have a spare pair.
customer_reviews.author: Chad & Nell

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift for my 19 year old son in GA. He loves it and it was a Big Bang for the buck❤️
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Boat!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little kayak. Perfect for the many rivers, canals, and waterways along the Florida Gulf Coast where we live. It's smaller size makes it easy to transport in our vehicle, eliminating the need to lift it up onto a roof rack. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Poirier

customer_reviews.title: Great fun on the water.
customer_reviews.text: Great on rivers or lakes. Light and can't tip it.
customer_reviews.author: lizard

customer_reviews.title: Great kayak!
customer_reviews.text: Fits in the back of my caravan! At 27 lbs I can load and unload it myself.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy174

customer_reviews.title: paddles well
customer_reviews.text: used for fishing best cast in front of boat for stability
customer_reviews.author: Kim A. Hardey

customer_reviews.title: side
customer_reviews.text: the kayak had area of scratches on the right side
customer_reviews.author: D. brown

customer_reviews.title: No foot rest, but came with paddle!
customer_reviews.text: Light weight...little tippy but needed an easier one to get on off the car
customer_reviews.author: Esther

customer_reviews.title: Decent I liked it but girlfriend didn’t
customer_reviews.text: I thought was ok, girlfriend got wobbly couldn’t track straight
customer_reviews.author: Jason Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Light and bright
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a Christmas present for my 11 year old son. So it hasn't been used yet but it looks like so much fun. I think he will love it. His favorite color and a place to store his cool stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Kerri Lynn Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Great for a small person
customer_reviews.text: These are great for my kids, not for adults. Tipsy!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The kayak is great, but there was quite a ordeal with the shipping of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: Did. not test well. Paddle kept hitting the sides because sides are higher than normal kayaks. Did not track well and zig zaged instead of going in straight line. Had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old's first kayak. This is a great deal and with free shipping, a no -brainer. The only thing it lacks are inner foot pegs. For a first boat or a value purchase, it's a great buy. The quality of the product, packaging and shipping are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: DiamondJoe

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Had a sharp edges on it but it was easly taken care of with plastic tape
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Okubo

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Received one of my kayaks and straps that hold items down were broke.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Value.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 2 of these kayaks for a couple years. I bought them because they were affordable, and Im not using them every weekend. They have proven to be good kayaks, and neither my wife or kids or myself have ever had any stability issues. I slightly modified one by adding rod holders and use it for fishing. I like it and would recommend it to the occasional kayaker.
customer_reviews.author: e daddy 978

customer_reviews.title: My first kayak
customer_reviews.text: I purchase my Aruba SS 8 SUNDOLPHIN KAYAK at a Sears outlet store in Homasassa, Fl, for $112.00. It was the last one. It fits inside my Honda Element. My first kayak. Im 58 yrs old. Im loving it. Its very stable and bright orange, easy to be seen on the water. Light weight and easy to carry, also with the large cockpit, easy to get in and out of . Im enjoying it. PS. I DO WEAR A LIFE JACKET.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M. Majewski

customer_reviews.title: We’ve been having so much fun with them that we’ve just purchased two more sun ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kayak last year at the end of season from a local sport department store. My husband got the 10 footer. We’ve been having so much fun with them that we’ve just purchased two more sun dolphin kayaks for our kids. We are beginner kayakers. Use it mostly for fishing and just leisure trips on nearby lakes. Nothing extreme. The kayaks are getting a lot more use than our bikes. They are a pleasure to be on.
customer_reviews.author: Luiza Kleina

customer_reviews.title: Has its pros and cons.
customer_reviews.text: I got this model because it was the lightest kayak I could find. It is very manageable to carry. In the water it feels a little unsteady, but I think I can get used to that. There are no foot pegs inside the kayak, so my legs were uncomfortable. Backrest very comfortable. The storage compartment is too small to fit my cell phone. Can probably just fit keys and maybe a small wallet. No holes in it to lock it up to a boat rack. Overall, it is a good value for what it costs. I would prefer a longer and narrower kayak, but again, I chose this one for its weight.
customer_reviews.author: Candy Moore

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for $100 less at Walmart. And I still hate it. I chose it because it was light enough for me to load, unload by myself. I didn't think beyond that. There are no foot rests, which affects more than you would think. And it is entirely too wide. Even on a tight budget, it's not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: CTmomma

customer_reviews.title: This is a great first time kayak
customer_reviews.text: This is a great first time kayak. I mostly have used it on lakes but have recently taken it on a river. Handles pretty well on the river as long as you are not near the weight capacity. I weigh 175 and it floats really well. It is not a straight tracking kayak so much with the flat bottom and short length but if you are not going for speed it is a perfect cruising kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Tab McBlane

customer_reviews.title: I have this kayak and I love it. Super light weight
customer_reviews.text: I have this kayak and I love it. Super light weight. Its a bit wobbly but once you get use to it, its no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ticia K.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good beginner kayak.
customer_reviews.text: I am 6'2 about 230lbs. Leg room is ok but it sits low in the water with me being 230lbs. Maybe ok for a someone a little lighter on the weight side of things. Even though it was sitting low in the water it is still a good ride on the lake. I added foot pegs to mine so that I could manipulate the balance a little better. All in all it's a pretty good beginner kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Adams

customer_reviews.title: Easy to carry. Wait for a calm day if over 175lbs.
customer_reviews.text: Very portable. Wife loves it as an entry level boat she can carry. We strapped it to the roof of a Prius with no problems after removing the roof antenna. I felt extremely unstable taking it out on the sound at a moderately athletic 6’0” 205. Tried several different postures but no luck. The weather report says winds up to 16mph today. My fault for pushing too hard I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Pritchett

customer_reviews.title: First kayak and I love it! My Only complaint is that it's hard ...
customer_reviews.text: First kayak and I love it! My Only complaint is that it's hard to sit in...need a cushion to help out, otherwise I'm enjoying it so far!
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced on amazon
customer_reviews.text: I bought this today, ocean blue color, at Walmart for $148 plus tax, it works well
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

product_meta.title: SUNDOLPHIN Sun Dolphin Aruba SS 8-Foot Sit-in Kayak
product_meta.description:
Perfect for family fun on the water. The Sun Dolphin Aruba SS 8' Sit-in Kayak tracks and paddles with ease while offering maximum stability. It is versatile, lightweight and great for all different ages. Includes: Adjustable padded seat back, dry storage compartment, spray deflector/ collar, recessed drink holder and convenient paddle holder. Specifications: Length: 96", Width: 28", Height: 16", Weight Capacity: 260lbs.


***Important information when placing your order***


Please verify address and telephone# are accurate. The carriers will contact the phone number on the order to set up a delivery appointment. If this information is inaccurate, there is a possibility that your order will be delayed or cancelled with a possible fee incurred at the sellers discretion.
feature_bullets: Light weight design easy to carry
***IMPORTANT – phone number is needed to schedule a delivery appointment***
